name: NPR
text:
Republicans claim, without proof, that right-wing views are being throttled on Facebook â€” despite publicly available data showing the exact opposite is true.

But that claim would be easier to debunk if Facebook was more transparent, former employees say.

name: NPR
text:

text:

name: NPR
text:

And with a challenge to the ACA expected to be argued a week after the election, it could become apparent fast just how far right the court will move if Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed.

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: #BREAKING: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to a just-released statement.

name: NPR
text:
The coronavirus spreading inside the White House is a stark reminder of the danger of relying only on testing to prevent outbreaks.

"A negative test does not give free license to forego all other safety measures," says a scientist at Columbia University.
https://t.co/191uFPAcsz

name: NPR
text:
The decision to treat President Trump with dexamethasone struck some doctors as surprising â€” given Dr. Sean Conley's fairly upbeat assessment of Trump's condition.

Typically, only hospitalized COVID-19 patients in need of oxygen are given the drug.

text:
